content.question: According to a 2018 survey, 74 percent of employed young adults expect to bring work on a vacation trip. A random sample of 20 employed young adults will be selected. What is the probability that 8 of the selected young adults will expect to bring work on a vacation trip?

choices.label: <math alttext="20 choose 8, times 0.26 to the eighth power, times 0.74 to the twelfth power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mtable><mtr><mtd><mrow><mn>20</mn></mrow></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>8</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><msup><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>0.26</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>0.74</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>12</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 4: Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Determine relative frequencies, proportions, or probabilities using simulation or calculations.
